content.title: Introduction
content.sortContent:
CSS3 is the latest standard for CSS.
CSS3 is completely backwards-compatible with earlier versions of CSS.
This section teaches you about the new features in CSS3!

content.title: Rounded Corners
content.sortContent:
CSS3 Rounded Corners

With the CSS3 border-radius property, you can give any element 'rounded corners'.

content.title: Border Images
content.sortContent:
CSS3 Border Images

With the CSS3 border-image property, you can set an image to be used as the border around an element.

content.title: Backgrounds
content.sortContent:
CSS3 Backgrounds

CSS3 contains a few new background properties, which allow greater control of the background element.

In this chapter you will learn how to add multiple background images to one element.

You will also learn about the following new CSS3 properties:

  • background-size
  • background-origin
  • background-clip

content.title: Colors
content.sortContent:
CSS supports color names, hexadecimal and RGB colors.
In addition, CSS3 also introduces:
  • RGBA colors
  • HSL colors
  • HSLA colors
  • opacity

content.title: Gradients
content.sortContent:
CSS3 gradients let you display smooth transitions between two or more specified colors.
Earlier, you had to use images for these effects. However, by using CSS3 gradients you can reduce download time and bandwidth usage. In addition, elements with gradients look better when zoomed, because the gradient is generated by the browser.
CSS3 defines two types of gradients:
  • Linear Gradients (goes down/up/left/right/diagonally)
  • Radial Gradients (defined by their center)

content.title: Shadows
content.sortContent:
CSS3 Shadow Effects

With CSS3 you can add shadow to text and to elements.
In this chapter you will learn about the following properties:
  • text-shadow
  • box-shadow

content.title: Text
content.sortContent:
CSS3 contains several new text features.
In this chapter you will learn about the following text properties:
  • text-overflow
  • word-wrap
  • word-break

content.title: Fonts
content.sortContent:
Web fonts allow Web designers to use fonts that are not installed on the user's computer.
When you have found/bought the font you wish to use, just include the font file on your web server, and it will be automatically downloaded to the user when needed.
Your 'own' fonts are defined within the CSS3 @font-face rule.

content.title: 2D Transforms
content.sortContent:
CSS3 transforms allow you to translate, rotate, scale, and skew elements.
A transformation is an effect that lets an element change shape, size and position.
CSS3 supports 2D and 3D transformations.

content.title: 3D Transforms
content.sortContent: CSS3 allows you to format your elements using 3D transformations.

content.title: Transitions
content.sortContent: CSS3 transitions allows you to change property values smoothly (from one value to another), over a given duration.

content.title: Animations
content.sortContent: CSS3 animations allows animation of most HTML elements without using JavaScript or Flash!
